item.title: Boil water notice in effect for Bradenton residents near 8th Ave
item.description: Testing may take up to 48 hours.

item.title: Unlikely friendship heals two troubled lives in “Dorothy’s Dictionary”
North Port police assist FBI in AI-created child porn arrest
item.description: Weatherly was in Sarasota County when his girlfriend found the images on his phone and called police.

item.title: FHP still seeing triple-digit speeders despite ‘Super Speeders’ law
item.description: Troopers recently arrested a man driving 105 miles per hour near Charlotte County.

item.title: All 5 soldiers shot at Fort Stewart expected to survive, fellow soldier in custody
item.description: The Army’s Fort Stewart in Georgia says five soldiers were shot and the base was locked down before a shooter was arrested.

item.title: Crash blocks U.S 301 near Haben Boulevard
item.description: Lanes were shut down for a time on U.S. 301 East near Haben Boulevard.

item.title: Rainy days return as afternoon storm pattern settles in
item.description: Rain chances go higher as we head into the weekend, and the Atlantic tropics continue to show lots of activity.

item.title: Back to school: Manatee interim superintendent talks with ABC7
item.description: Interim Superintendent Kevin Chapman sat down to talk about what to expect this new school year.

item.title: New grant allows for water testing in south Sarasota County bays
item.description: Suncoast Waterkeeper will be able to add eight new bacteria testing sites.

item.title: Passenger in fatal Bradenton crash charged with tampering with evidence
item.description: Robert Viera was arrested Aug. 4 after investigators viewed surveillance video.

item.title: INTERVIEW: Titanic enthusiast reflects on USCG Titan Submersible report
item.description: OceanGate waited more than seven hours before alerting authorities that the sub was missing.

item.title: Day of Giving: Donate School Supplies for Local Teachers and Students on Aug. 7
item.description: It's your chance to help local teachers and make a difference for kids in the upcoming academic year.
